definition: to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: Differences with regard to the incidence of natural inversion polymorphism are likely to exist between species as well as between sub-species.
sentences.chinese: 自然倒位多型性的發生率在種間以及亞種間可能不同。

sentences.english: The males suspected to have induced inversions were later used to build up stocks .
sentences.chinese: 疑有誘發倒位的雄性然後用於建立原種。

sentences.english: Objective :To study the effect on filial generation of patients with balance translocation and inversion.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究平衡易位和倒位攜帶者對下一代的影響。

definition: allele (one of two paired gene in diploid organism)
base pairing (e.g. adenine A 腺嘌呤 pairs with thymine T 胸腺嘧啶 in DNA)/base pair
cytosine nucleotide (C, pairs with guanine G 鳥嘌呤|鸟嘌呤 in DNA and RNA)
